div.head: THE EGYPTIAN GAZETTE
No. 7,672] ALEXANDRIA, MONDAY, JANUARY 28, 1907. [EIGHT PAGES P.T. 1.
The Eastern Telegraph Company, Limited.
div.p:
This Company's system of submarine telegraph
cables is the most direct and quickest means of
communication from Egypt to Europe, North and
South America, East, South and West Africa,
India, Australia, New Zealand, China and Japan.

To secure quick transmission, telegrams should
be marked Via Eastern.

For latest average time to London, see daily
bulletin in this paper.

STATIONS IN EGYPT: Alexandria, Cairo,
Suez, Port-Tewfik, Port-Saïd, Suakin. Head
Office. London.

div.head: Orient-Royal Mail Line.
div.p: REDUCED SUMMER FARES FROM MAY TO OCTOBER INCLUSIVE.
OUTWARD to AUSTRALIA.
R.M.S. “Ophair" will leave Suez about February 8
R.M.S "Omrah" will leave Suez about February 22.
HOMEWARD to NAPLES, MARSEILLES, GIBRALTAR, PLYMOUTH, LONDON, TILBURY.
R.M.S. "Oroya" will leave Port Said January 28
R.M.S. “Ortona" will leave Port Said Febrary 13<!--check this date-->

The issue of return tickets to and from Egypt has been discontinued. Passengers paying full fare one direction will, however, be allowed abtement of one-third off fare back if return voyage be made within four months of arrival, or, abatement of 20 if return voyage be made within six-months of arrival.
Special rates during Summer season 15th May-- 15th September.
Agents. Cairo:—Thosmas Cook & Son. Alexandria : —R. J. Moss & Co.—For all information apply to
Wm. STAPLEDON & Sons, PORT SAID and PORT-TEWFIK (Suez). 31-12-906 <

HOMEWARDS to MARSEILLES and LONDON.
S.S. Worcestershire 7,160 tons, will leave Port Saidabout Jan. 26th.
FARES from Port Said to Marseilles £12.0.0, London £17.0.0, Colombo £32.10.0, Rangoon £37.10.0.

SPECIAL REDUCED FARES DURING THE SUMMER SEASON
Agents Cairo: THOS. COOK & SON. For all particulars apply to WM. STAPLEDON & SONS, PORT SAID & SUEZ.

div.head: Deutsche Levante-Linie.
div.p: Mail and Passenger Steamships. Regular service fortnightly from HAMBURG, weekly from ANTWERP; every 4 weeks from Bordeaux direct to ALEXANDRIA; homewards every 2 weeks from Alexandria for Rotterdam and Hamburg. Goods fowarded at through-ates from all Germ Railway Stations on direct Bills of Ladings to Alexandria, Cairo, Syria, etc. Special facilites foor conveyance of cotton, etc from Alexandria, via Rotterdam and Hamburf to German manufacturing towns.
STEAMERS AT ALEXANDRIA.
S.S. Eys now in port discarfing will sail for Paraeus.
S.S. Tinos now in port discharging will sail for Rotterdam & Hamburg on or about the 29.
Expect: Jan. 24 S.S Paros from Antwerp-- Jan. 30 S.S Enos from Hamburg.
For tariff and particulars apply to ADOLPHE STROSS, Alexandria, Agent.

div.head: KHEDIVIAL MAIL LINE.
div.p: Express Steamers leave Alexandria every Wednesday at 4 p.m. for PIRAEUS, SMYRNA, MITYLENE, and CONSTANTINOPLE, in connection with Orient Express train-de-luxe for Vienna, Paris, and London.

Fast steamers leave Alexandria every Saturday at 4 p.m., and Port Said every Sunday at 6 p.m., for JAFFA (for Jerusalem), CAIFFA (for Nazareth), BEYROUT (for Damascus), TRIPOLI, ALEXANDRETTA, MESSINA, continuing in alternate weeks to LARNACA and LIMASSOL (Cyprus).

Steamers leave Suez weekly on Wednesday at 6 p.m. for PORT SUDAN and SUAKIN direct returning from Suakin every Wednesday noon. Every Monday at 6 p.m. a steamers leaves Suez for Jeddah continuing every other week to Suakin, Massowah, Hodeidah, Aden. Intermediate steamers do not proceed beyond Jeddah but call at Tor, (for Sinai) El Wedj and Yambo as required.
N.B.—Deck chairs provided for the use of passengers, excellent cuisine and table wine free.
Steamer plans may be seen and passages booked at the Company’s Agencies at Alexandria, Cairo, Port Said, and Suez, or at THOS. COOK & SON or other Tourist Agency.

div.head: The Moss S.S. Company, Ltd.
div.p: For LIVERPOOL calling at MALTA (Messrs. JAMES MOSS & Co. 31, James St, Liverpool, Managers.)

*Second class accommodation only, unless specially reserved.—Fares : Alexandria to Liverpool, 1st, £14 Single, £25 Return. 2nd, £9 Single, £15 Return.—To Malta, 1st, £5 Single, £9 Return, 2nd, £3 Single, £5 Return.—Return tickets available for six months.
S.S. Seti now on the berth, will sail on or about Tuesday, 19th Januarty, to be followed by S.S. Monopthahs.
Through freight rates on cotton, etc., to Lancashire inland towns, Boston, New York and other U.S.A. towns, obtained on application. Cargo taken by special agreement only.
Passenger Tickets also issued inclusive of Railway fare through to and from Cairo.
For particulars apply R. J. MOSS & Co., Alexandria, Agents.

div.head: P. HENDERSON & CO’s LINE.
div.p: The Steamers lof thisLline eave SUEZ and PORT SAID every fortnight for LONDON or LIVERPOOL direct.
SALOON FARE £12.
S.S. PEUU 5800 Tons will leave PORT SAID about 31st January for Hamburg & Dover.
S.S. AMARAPOORA 6800 Tons will leave ALEXANDRIA 13th February for Liverpool.
S.S. ARRACAN 6000 Tons will leave ALEXANDRIA 13th February for Liverpool.
Due in LONDON or LIVERPOOL 13 days.
The Salloon accomodation is amidships, and the vessels are fitted throughout with electric Light and have the latest imporvments.
For futher information apply to the COmpany;s Agents.
WORMS & Co., Port Said and Suez. THOS. COOK & SON, (EGYPT) LD., CAIRO ;
G. J. GRACE & CO., ALEXANDRIA.

div.head: WHITE STAR LINE.
div.p: NEW YORK AND BOSTON MEDITERRANEAN SERVICE.
Regular Sailings between Alexandria , Naples, and Boston or New York, U.S.A. By the large modern twin screw steamers CEDRIC, 21,035 tons- CELTIC, 21,00- REPUBLIC, 15,400 tons- CANOPIC, 13,000 tons.

Regular Service between Italy and United States throughout the year. Excellent accommodation for all classes of passengers. For plans of steamers, rates of passengers between the various ports, and full particulars, apply to THOS, COOK & SON (Egypt) Ltd., Cairo, Alexandria, Luxor and Assouan; John Ross & Co., Alexandria; White Star Line, Via Roma, Geona, and 21, Piazza della Borsa, Naples.

div.head: Austrian Lloyd’s Steam Navigation
div.p: Alexandria-Brindisi- Trieste (VENICE). Express Mail Service. Steamers leave Alexandria Saturdays 4 p.m. arrive at Brindisi Tuesdays 5 a.m. in time for Express to Milan, Lucerne, Paris, Vienna, Berlin, London, leaving Brindisi 7 a.m. Arrival at Trieste Wednesday about 11 a.m connecting witht the Train de-Luxe, Trieste-Vienna Ostende. Passengers reach London Fridays 4:50 p.m.
Steamer leaves Alexandria every Thursday 10 a.m.
Syrian-Cyprus-Caramanian Line. Steamer leaves Alexandria about 7, 15, 21, 29 January, (4 p.m.)
Far East Lines. Departures from Port Said: To Suez, Aden, Bombay, Colombo, Penang, Singapore, Hong-Kong, Shanghai, Yokohama and Kobé, 3 Feb.,6 March, 3 April.
To Suez, Aden and Bombay accelerated service 7, 22 Jan., 7, 22 Feb.; 7, 23 March ; 8, 23 April ; 8 May.
To Suez, Aden, Karachi, Colombo, Madras, Rangoon, and Calcutta about 18 Jan., 18 Feb., 18 March, 18 April, 18 May.

div.head: THE NATIONAL HOTEL, Cairo
div.p: One of the finest and most up-to-date Hotels in the Metropolis. Situated in Sharia Soliman Pasha, the very centre of the healthiest and most fashionable quarter. Stands in its own grounds with garden and lawn tennis grounds at back. Over 350 rooms and 5 saloons. Magnificent salle à manger. Handsome covered promenade verandah, 80 yards long. Highest class cuisine, electric light throughout, and lifts. English comforts. Rooms and apartments at prices to suit everyone. For further particulars apply to GENERAL MANAGER, Cairo.

div.head: The George Nungovich Hotels.
div.p: GRAND HOTEL, HELOUAN.-- Finest and most luxurious Hotel near Cairo. Patronized by Royalty. Moderate charges. Special terms for residents.

HOTEL DES BAINS.-- Most comfortable hotel, opposite the Baths. Pension from P.T. 45. Attached to the above hotels and specially for their clients are the Golf Links (18 holes) with English Professional. Own Gold House in the desert.
SULPHUR BATH ESTABLISHMENT.-- Shulphur water stronger than any in Europe. Eight European Masse in and Masseuseu Eve y modern improvement.

div.head: NEW VICTORIA HOTEL,
div.p: San Stefano, Near Alexandria, Halt No. 2.
Open all the year round.

Specially built in 1904 for a class Hotel with every modern comfort. Magnificent Dining room, Saloons, Smoking room, largo Verandahs and Garden. Electric light. MODERATE CHARGES. Express Motor Cars meet trains from Cairo at Sidi Gaber and Alexandria Stations. The Management have also arranged for the Motor Cars to meet all steamers.Special terms for Government Officials and Officers of the Army of Occupation. C. F. RAISIG. Manager.
RESTAURANT AND BAR OPEN TO NON-RESIDENTS.

div.head: GHEZIREH PALACE HOTEL
div.p: On the bank of the Nile. Formed by the Palace of the Kadive Ismail. Transformed into a luxurious hotel.
Spelendid Park
Renowned for its afternoon teas on the West Balcony overlooking the Park. Excellent Taigane Orchestra. Motor car runing to Shepheard's Hotel and vice versa.

div.head: CAIRO-SAVOY HOTEL.
div.p: Is Now Open

div.head: TEWFIK PALACE HOTEL.
div.p: HALOUAN, near CAIRO

Formerly the favourite Residence of the H.H. the late Khedive. Perfect Sanitation.-- Purest Desert air. Electric Light. Hot and cold baths attached to most rooms. House warmed by special system of Radiators adjoinging the Golf Link and Race Course, Tennis, Billards, Garden and open air palm house, good stabling, dark room. Excellent Table. Moderate charges. Medical Resident Director: ARTHUR J. M. BENTLEY. M.D.-- Town Office at Stephenson & Co., Opera Square, Cairo.
P.E Hergel, Manager

div.head: GRAND HOTEL, KHARTOUM.
div.p: The only First Class Hotel at Khartoum, prettily situatied in its extensive Palm Gardens on the Banks of teh Blue Nile, with commanding view from the terrace of the Hotel ove the Bluw and White Nile, Omdornian, and the Battlefields of Kerreb.
Entirely re-built. enlarged and refurbished in 1906; replete with all modern European comforts.
Electric Light, Stream Laundry, Lawn-Tennis, Stabling, Boating, own farm and Dairy products
Cosmopolitan Cuisine, European service.
Terms:-- From P.T. 100 to 125 per person and per day Special term for a prolonged stay
G. OTTO BOOK Manager

div.head: GORDON HOTEL, KHARTOUM.
div.p: Open in November.
Most comfortable and best Hotel in town. Central situation, affording splendid view. No mosquittoes. Electric light. Carriages at landing stage at tourists disposal. Cellar renowned.
BEST CUISINE.-- OPEN ALL THE YEAR ROUND.

div.head: SAVOY PALACE HOTEL.
THE HOTEL DE LUZE OF ALEXANDRIA.
div.p: Will be Open Shortly

div.head: Direction der Disconto-Gesellschaft
div.p: Berlin - Bremen - Frankfurt a. M. - London.
Capital (fully paid-up) M 170 000 000
Reserve Fund ... M 57 600 000
Represented at Hamburg by the Norddeutsche Bank in Hamburg.
The bank transacts general banking business of every description and acts as representative of the following foreign banks:
Brasilianische Bank für Deutschland of Hamburg, with branches at Rio de Janeiro, Sao Paulo, Santos and Porto Alegre.
Bank für Chile und Deutschland of Hamburg, with branches at Valparaiso, Santiago, Concepcion, Temuco, Antofagasta, La Paz and Oruro.
Ernesto Tornquist & Co. Buenos Aires.
Deutsch- Asiatische Bank of Shanghai, with branohes at Berlin, Calcutta, Hankow, Hongkong, Kobe, Peking, Tientsin, Tsinanfu, Tsingtau, Yokohama.
Banca Generala Romana of Bakarest, with branches at Braila, Crajeva and an Agency at Constantza, Ploesti, Giurgiui
Kreditna Banka (Banque de Credit) at Sofia, with a banch at Varna.
Deutsche Afrika-Bank, Hamburg with branches at Swakopmund, Windhuk and Lüderitzbucht (South West Africa).

div.head: HIGH-CLASS TOOLS
div.p: For Miners, Contractors, and Agriculturists.
The “UNIVERSAL” PICKS.
Picks, Spades, Shovels, Forks, Axes, Hoes, Fasses, Hammers, Wedges, Crowbars, etc.
HAND and POWER BORING MACHINES for Rock and Coal.
"HARDY" DRILL STEEL.
Hickory Handles.
THE HARDY PATENT PICK CO., LTD., SHEFFIELD, ENGLAND.
